results.name: Cross-Session Recall
results.description: Validates semantic recall of policy decisions across sessions with paraphrased queries

steps.description: Session 1 (Tuesday): User states language constraint with decision record ID and nonce

response.response:
Based on the provided Decision Record DR-014, the key points are:

1. The project team has decided to use Java only for the integration project, and rejected the use of Python [#1].
2. The decision to use Java exclusively has been finalized, and the team has been instructed not to re-open this decision [#2].

fullResult.input: Decision Record DR-014 (Nonce Q7F3): We rejected Python for this integration project. We must use Java only. Do not re-open this decision.

observe.input: Decision Record DR-014 (Nonce Q7F3): We rejected Python for this integration project. We must use Java only. Do not re-open this decision.

steps.description: Session 2 (Friday): User asks about language choice, requesting decision record ID and nonce

response.response: Based on the information provided, it appears you are referring to a decision made as part of an integration project. However, without access to the specific project details or decision records, I cannot provide the programming language that was standardized on. I do not have access to any project memory or decision records. I can only respond based on the information you have directly provided in your query. If you are able to share the relevant decision record ID and nonce, I would be happy to review that information and provide a more detailed response. [#1]
